document_data.name: Ciara Blank
document_data.mainbody:
'''Ciara Blank''' was a laborer and a printer who worked for the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette'' in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{Quote|The paper quality's atrocious! Worn edges, easy tearing â€“ that newfangled mechanical printworks is to blame.|Ciara Blank}}
document_data.Description: Ciara was a dark-skinned [[gold dwarven]] woman. She wore commoner's clothes and kept her face clean-shaven.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Ciara lost her printing job Baldur's Mouth after the [[broadsheet]]'s editor-in-chief, [[Ettvard Needle]], received a gift of an [[enchanted]] [[printing press]] from Lord [[Enver Gortash]]. Ciara lamented the changing times but critiqued the ''Gazette'' over its poor [[paper]] quality and smudgy [[ink]].
